1.text: A Man of reproofs hardening the neck, shall be suddenly broken, and no healing.

2.text: In the increasing of the just the people will rejoice: and in the ruling of the unjust one the people will groan.

3.text: A man loving wisdom will gladden his father: and he feeding harlots shall destroy riches.

4.text: A king in judgment shall establish the land: and a man of presents shall overthrow it.

5.text: A man making smooth against his neighbor spreads a net for his steps.

6.text: In the transgression of an evil man is a snare: and the just one shall rejoice and be glad:

7.text: The just one knew the judgment of the poor: the unjust one will not understand knowledge.

8.text: Men of derision will kindle up a city: and the wise will turn away anger.

9.text: A wise man contending with a foolish man and raging and laughing, and no rest.

10.text: Men of bloods will hate the upright one: and the upright will seek his soul.

11.text: The foolish one will bring forth all his spirit; and the wise one will restrain it back.

12.text: A ruler listening to the word of falsehood, all serving him are unjust.

13.text: The poor one and the man of oppressions met together: Jehovah enlightening the eyes of them both.

14.text: The king judging the poor in truth, his throne shall be established for a testimony.

15.text: The rod and reproofs will give wisdom: and the youth being left shames his mother.

16.text: In increasing the unjust, transgressions will increase: and the just all look upon their fall.

17.text: Correct thy son and he shall cause thee to rest, and he shall give delight to thy soul.

18.text: In no vision the people shall be unruly: and he watching the law, happy is he.

19.text: A servant will not be corrected by words: for he will understand and not answer.

20.text: Thou sawest a man hasty in his words: hope to the foolish one more than to him.

21.text: He bringing up his servant delicately from youth, and his latter state will be a child.

22.text: A man of anger will excite strife, and the possessor of wrath increased transgression.

23.text: A man’s pride shall bring him low: and honor shall uphold him humble of spirit.

24.text: He dividing with a thief, hates his soul: he shall hear cursing and shall not announce.

25.text: The fear of man will give a snare: and he trusting in Jehovah shall be exalted.

26.text: Many are seeking the face of the ruler, and from Jehovah a man’s judgment.

27.text: A man of iniquity is an abomination of the just; and the upright of way, an abomination of the unjust one.
